name: Malleswara Darshan heritage walk.
description: This is our walk in one of the oldest suburbs of the "old Bangalore". Join us on a 'darshan' of the many temples and other religious institutes that dot this area as we narrate to you its origins and about the celebrities/personalities who called it their 'home'. Also on this walk learn more about the Maratha connection to this neighborhood as well as how a philanthropist not only helped renovate the Kadu Malleswara temple but also helped create an entire lake in the days gone by.See how Kadu Malleswara turned into a "Mall-e-swarm" and is fast losing not only it's heritage structures but also its local culture. In between all the bytes of history we take bites from an iconic eatery in the this area.So join us on this walk next and get to know Malleswaram in a completely new light.

location.address: Sampige Road, Malleshwaram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560003, India

organizer.name: Bengaluru by foot
organizer.description: Heritage, food & architectural walks in Bangalore.

name: Dialogues with Books
description: Dialogues with Books Join us for our book club meetup every third Sunday of the month. Bring along your favorite book, the book you are currently reading, or any book that had an impact on you. Share your experience reading the book with fellow bibliophiles and participate in winding and fun discussions around the joy of reading. Do all this while sipping on coffee/tea or having a hot tasty snack from our cafe! Your Host - Bharat is an avid reader with a penchant for classical literature and philosophy. He also dabbles in writing with a diverse portfolio of works across tech, philosophy, magical realism and fantasy. His reading diet includes a mix of fiction and non-fiction with his favorite novels being The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Movable feast by Hemmingway and Crime and Punishment by Dostoevsky.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Dialogues Poetry Open Mic
description: Lovers of poetry and prose — this one is for you!Whether you like listening, reading or performing poems or short stories, be ready to be entertained. We are on a journey to create safe spaces for the writers in town — to share their writing with like-minded people and become part of our community. You can hold us accountable for making you have a good time!Join us at Dialogues Cafe,Koramangala from 7:30 PM onwards, on every 3rd Sunday

name: Utta Atta by grand-mother & grand-daughter
description: This is an experience centre run by grand mother & grand daughter more than place to just dine, an experience to taste/learn old Karnataka/South Indian vegetarian food from a homeprenuer who is passionate of cooking. This is going to add her portfolio of making/selling chutneys/powders & making/selling homemade food using Triveni's Kitchen. Another experience is to learn/play old traditional Indian games with her granddaughter. She is not a pro though, but can certainly ensure you fun by the end of the session.

organizer.description: Cooking with passion since 1980

name: The Wellness Day Retreat
description: Welcome to the first ever Wellness Day Retreat at the Studio.The intention of this retreat is to help you feel a sense of companionship and clarity in your wellness journey. We want you to feel seen in your struggles, let go of the pressure to “race” towards wellness, explore the feeling that you are not enough and embrace the belief that you are enough, just as you are.Event DescriptionThis half-day retreat is an opportunity to step away from the constant striving and reconnect with a sense of ease, connection, and self-compassion. Over the course of four hours, we’ll create a safe, nurturing space for you to explore one of the most difficult issues we face - why we feel we are not enough, just as we are.This experience will be a digital detox -absolutely no phones for 4 hours (you'll keep them in a basket), as we believe only after a few hours of disconnection from your phone can you reconnect with your body. There will be down-time in the middle of the day to read a book, meet new people or just watch the sunset in solitude from our beautiful, spacious Studio. The half-day retreat will include:•	A dynamic yoga session•	A guided meditative experience•	A therapist-facilitated conversation around 'not enoughness' in a sharing circle•	A mindful eating experience to connect with yourself and your body including a healthy plant-based meal.   Healthy snacks, herbal tea, detox water and essential oils available throughout the day..   You’ll also have access to our Connection Corner, featuring tools for journaling, introspection, and relaxation, like palo santo, essential oils, and tarot cards.This will be a journey to help you embrace the truth that you are enough, just as you are.Who Is This For? Anyone seeking a compassionate space to explore their wellness journey, connect with like-minded individuals, and feel grounded in their own rhythm.*Details:*📍Location: the Studio by Copper+Cloves🗓️ Date & Time: February 2nd, 3pm onwards🎟️ Investment: ₹3500 plus taxesCome as you are, and leave feeling held, seen, and enough.

location.name: Copper + Cloves

name: Woodcutprinting  Beginner's Workshop
description: Woodcut is a relief printing technique in printmaking. The participants carve an image into the surface of a block of wood—typically with gouges—leaving the printing parts level with the surface while removing the non-printing parts. Areas that the artist cuts away carry no ink, while characters or images at surface level carry the ink to produce the print.All the materials will be provided. The tools will be provided only for use. No prior experience required, we will teach you from scratch.The size of the block is A4 . You take home your carved block with 2 prints.We’ll be teaching a black and white composition. If you have a composition in mind that you want to work on, you can get the sketch or a print out of it. If you don’t have anything specific in mind, you can choose from the references we have.Join us at Studio Sakura 🌸 to unleash your creativity and experience the magic of printmaking.

organizer.name: Studio Sakura
organizer.description: Printmaking Studio

name: Colour Reduction Woodcut Printing Workshop
description: Color-reduction woodcut is a traditional and much more complicated form of printmaking which allows the artist to create editionable multi-colored prints. With this method, a single block is carved and printed successively resulting in an edition of identical prints.Colour reduction woodcut printing workshop(2 day workshop)Fees: Rs. 3750All the materials will be provided. The tools will be provided only for use. No prior experience required, we will teach you from scratch. You take home your carved block with 2 prints. The size of the block is A4.We’ll be teaching colour reduction woodcut. You will be printing a colour woodcut with two or three layers of colour depending on the composition. If you have a composition in mind that you want to work on, you can get the sketch or a print out of it. If you don’t have anything specific in mind, you choose from the references we have.Please keep in mind to choose a simple composition. Avoid compositions that require a lot of intricate carving.Please reach the venue by 11am. Avoid wearing light coloured clothes.Join us at Studio Sakura 🌸 to unleash your creativity and experience the magic of printmaking.

name: A 2 Day Natural Fitness Kalaripayattu Workshop
description: We are hosting a 2-day Live Kalaripayattu workshop on 15th & 16 Feb 2025 (Saturday & Sunday)We are bringing to you Specially curated exercises inspired from Kalaripayattu that can be practised at the comfort of your home.What's included in the Workshop:A 2 Day Live workshop provided by Experienced Kalaripayattu Teachers on 15th & 16 Feb 2025 eachThere would be 1.5 hours of a Online session 1 week prior to the workshop to brief you about the workshop and to provide Theoretical Introduction to the Kalaripayattu movements and to address other question and answers.Support through whatsapp / Call in future.This workshop is open for both Adults and Kids. There movements would be different and according to the respective age groupsBenefits of attending this Workshop:Learn Scientific , Natural Kalaripayattu Movements as a fitness routine to include in your day to day Lifestyle (no equipments required)Improve Mental Focus & MindfulnessDevelop A Stronger, Healthier Spine

name: Linocut Printing Beginner's Workshop
description: Linocut Printing Beginners Workshop  A linocut is a type of relief or block print, and bears a lot of similarities to woodblock printing. Essentially, the artist carves an image into a linoleum (lino) block and what's left of the block is inked and printed In this workshop you will be learning to transfer, carve and print a lino block. All the materials will be provided. The tools will be provided only for use. No prior experience required, we will teach you from scratch. You take home your carved block with 2 prints. 🖼️🖼️ We’ll be teaching a black and white composition. If you have a composition in mind that you want to work on, you can get the sketch or a print out of it. If you don’t have anything specific in mind, you choose from the references we have. Join us at Studio Sakura 🌸 to unleash your creativity and experience the magic of printmaking.

name: Love finds it's way
description: Find the love within that you seek around. Nupur Bahuguna & Dimpy Fadhya Welcome you to an inmersive experiential workshop where we will perform : Intention setting As we speak, we attractConnect with the love consciousness to tap into the ocean of love that fills you up.Setting our unified and individual intentions we begin our workshop. Breathwork Undo & let go of the barriers that you have built against the love you seek Letting go of the conditioning and thoughts that keeps one in chasing energies rather than attracting. Chakra Frequency Alignment Working and balancing of Heart and Root chakras through Frequency AlignmentTo become aligned with the energies of Love within us and releasing the fear of judgement Guided meditations Tap into our highest, abundant and most loving version of selfFall in love with ourselves to attract better. Things to carry 1. Yoga mat 2. ⁠Water 3. ⁠Comfortable clothing 4. ⁠Journal/ pen 5. ⁠Your divine self

name: Strength & Flow Series : Arm Balance Workshop
description: The next workshop in our Strength and Flow Series with Shruti is an arm balance workshop .Designed for all levels, Shruti’s workshop challenges both physical and mental resilience. Expect a series of arm balances, enabling you to get stronger and gain the benefits that come with holding arm balances. This workshop encourages you to sit with discomfort, move through it, and emerge stronger—mentally and physically. As Shruti says, “It won’t be easy,” but the growth will be worth it.After class, you can expect a protein-packed smoothie.Let’s start the year strong with nourishment and community. 🌱

name: Minds in Motion - Breakfast with Founders, Creator
description: Dear Founders & Creators,Please Join the whatsapp group for more info- https://chat.whatsapp.com/HhdR5vitXN4ExjOa4Hvh5eWe're excited to invite you to an exclusive Breakfast with Founders and Creators event, designed for collaboration, spark innovation, and build authentic connections in a relaxed, informal setting.This is an opportunity to connect with like-minded entrepreneurs and creators, share insights, discuss challenges, and celebrate each other’s journeys. This gathering is all about sharing experiences, learning together, and growing as a community.Details:⏰ Time: 11:00 AM – 1:00 PM📍 Venue: The venue will be shared with confirmed participants.Our goal is to create a space where meaningful conversations happen, ideas flow freely, and we all leave inspired and connected. Whether you’re looking for new collaborations, insights, or simply a supportive community, this meetup is for you.Looking forward to seeing you there!

name: One Year of WIP | February 8
description: Welcome to Wine in Progress (WIP)At WIP, we're all about keeping it real, unpretentious, and oh-so-welcoming—just like your favorite backyard hangout, but with a fabulous upgrade! Whether you're a wine connoisseur or just looking to wine down, we've got you covered with curated delights that'll tickle your taste buds and leave you craving more.We are a tiny 14-seater dive bar for wine (with 3 outdoor picnic tables), so book a table with us if you want to snag a seat. We’ve got bottles of curated wines, Japanese small plates by Naru Noodle Bar, and music to set the vibe just right.One-Year of WIPThe Wine in Progress crew is celebrating its first anniversary with a bang! Joining us for the day are the boys from Bandra—Chefs Gresham and Manoj—who will be cooking up a storm with their special menu.On the decks, from 7:30 PM to 9:30 PM, Kristel sets the vibe with her smooth and fun "Groovy Theory," guaranteed to have you dancing in your seats. After that, Chef Gresh takes over, spinning funky house and nu-disco beats to keep the party going.It’s going to be a night of great food, groovy tunes, and unforgettable vibes—don’t miss it!If you’d like to drop by WIP on a regular day, just click this link here. Please Note :The booking fee is only redeemable against the wine menu and WIP Food menu only.Our bar offers seating for 8 individuals at the bar itself, as well as 3 two-seater tables.As a small, cozy bar, we may occasionally need to join tables, so expect to brush elbows! If you have specific requirements, please don't hesitate to reach out to us.To ease operations, the bar team may reallocate your seats despite your preferences to ensure the best overall experience for all guests. In such cases, seating will be determined by the WIP Team at their discretion.We kindly request payments via alternative methods, as we do not accept cash transactions.All sales are final. Rescheduling must be requested at least 48 hours in advance, with only one opportunity to reschedule. In the event of a cancellation or no-show, payments are non-refundable.We allocate tables in 2-hour time slots to accommodate as many guests as possible and appreciate your understanding. Our team will notify you 15 minutes before your time is up.

location.name: Courtyard
location.address: 105, Kengal Hanumanthaiah Rd, opp. Corporation Bank, Raja Ram Mohanroy Extension, Shanti Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560027, India

organizer.name: Courtyard
organizer.description: COURTYARD is a gathering of ideas and experiences in  the heart of Bangalore. We are an open space for curated  culinary, cultural and creative exchanges, in any form they  choose to take

name: "A Journey Within"
description: Event 1: 9th February 2025Title of event 1: The Love Languages Experience What Happens:●    Activity 1: An Icebreaker sharing or game●    Activity 2: Brief introduction to the 5 Love Languages through stories.●    Activity 3: Participants take a quick quiz to identify their love language.●    Activity 4: Group activity: Pair participants to create scenarios or gestures to express each love language ●    Activity 5: Pick an Oracle card●    Takeaway: Each person creates for themselves a personalized "Love Language Card" with tips on how to nurture their relationship with themselves and others. Event 2: 16th February 2025Title of event 2: Love Letters: The Art of Expressing AffectionWhat Happens:●    Activity 1: Icebreaker sharing/game (may include sharing memorable moments of receiving or writing a love letter)●    A short guided meditation on Compassion & Unconditional Love●    Activity 2: Guided session on crafting a heartfelt letter (whether for romantic love, self-love, or appreciation for friends/family).●    Activity 3: Optional sharing of letters in small groups or anonymously posting them on a “Wall of Love” at the café.●    Takeaway: Beautiful stationery or a postcard to encourage participants to continue writing love letters since the world needs more love letters  Event 3: 23rd February 2025Title for event 3: Love Yourself First: A Self-Love WorkshopTheme: Building Self-Compassion and Confidence What Happens: ●    Activity 1: Icebreaker ●    Quick mindfulness meditation to connect with self.●    Activity 2: Fun reflective exercise: “What I Love About Me” (participants list their strengths and joys).●    Oracle cards on love your body – each participant can pick one and journal for a few mins what it means to them, or share in a sharing circle●    Activity 3: Group activity: Create a "Self-Love Jar" with affirmations or small acts of kindness participants can gift themselves.●    Takeaway: A jar filled with affirmations or prompts to practice self-love regularly.

location.address: 1316/F, 1316/E, 18 B Main Rd, near VLCC BEAUTY CLINIC ( JP Nagar, Bangalore ), Marenahalli, 2nd Phase, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560078, India

organizer.name: The Kind Roastery and Brew Room

themselves and others. Event 2: 16th February 2025Title of event 2: Love Letters: The Art of Expressing AffectionWhat Happens:●    Activity 1: Icebreaker sharing/game (may include sharing memorable moments of receiving or writing a love letter)●    A short guided meditation on Compassion & Unconditional Love●    Activity 2: Guided session on crafting a heartfelt letter (whether for romantic love, self-love, or appreciation for friends/family).●    Activity 3: Optional sharing of letters in small groups or anonymously posting them on a “Wall of Love” at the café.●    Takeaway: Beautiful stationery or a postcard to encourage participants to continue writing love letters since the world needs more love letters  Event 3: 23rd February 2025Title for event 3: Love Yourself First: A Self-Love WorkshopTheme: Building Self-Compassion and Confidence What Happens: ●    Activity 1: Icebreaker ●    Quick mindfulness meditation to connect with self.●    Activity 2: Fun reflective exercise: “What I Love About Me” (participants list their strengths and joys).●    Oracle cards on love your body – each participant can pick one and journal for a few mins what it means to them, or share in a sharing circle●    Activity 3: Group activity: Create a "Self-Love Jar" with affirmations or small acts of kindness participants can gift themselves.●    Takeaway: A jar filled with affirmations or prompts to practice self-love regularly.

location.address: 1316/F, 1316/E, 18 B Main Rd, near VLCC BEAUTY CLINIC ( JP Nagar, Bangalore ), Marenahalli, 2nd Phase, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560078, India

organizer.name: The Kind Roastery and Brew Room

name: The Himalayan Table - A Garhwali Food Pop Up
description: Welcome to Shades of Garhwal - a traveling kitchen to promote the culinary delights from the Garhwal region.We may have pursued very different careers, but we share a deep love for food and how it connects us to the world. For us, exploring a new country isn’t complete without a visit to the local grocery stores to discover fresh produce and unique ingredients. Cooking and hosting have always been second nature to us, and as proud Pahadi women, we’ve embarked on a journey to rediscover and preserve the rich culinary heritage of the Garhwal region.For us, food is more than just sustenance—it’s a way to connect, to share, and to bond. Through this pop-up, we want to bring people together to savor authentic Garhwali flavors while immersing in the history, culture, and traditions that make each dish special. It’s not just a meal; it’s a celebration of heritage and a chance to create meaningful memories around the table.We hope to see you soon! ❤️- Salomi & Pushkina

location.address: 56, 1st Main Rd, Domlur I Stage, 1st Stage, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

name: Colour Reduction Linocut Printing Workshop
description: Colour Reduction Linocut Printing Workshop 1 day workshop All the materials will be provided. The tools will be provided only for use. No prior experience required, we will teach you from scratch.You take home your carved block with 2 prints. We’ll be teaching colour reduction linocut. The size of the block is A5. We will be printing a colour linocut with two layers of colour depending on the composition. If you have a composition in mind that you want to work on, you can get the sketch or a print out of it. If you don’t have anything specific in mind, you choose from the references we have.*Please keep in mind to choose a simple composition. Avoid compositions that require a lot of intricate carving.*Please reach the venue by 11am. Avoid wearing light coloured clothes.Join us at Studio Sakura 🌸 to unleash your creativity and experience the magic of printmaking.

location.address: 34, Rest House Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Sampangi Rama Nagara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

name: Drypoint Etching Beginner's Workshop
description: Drypoint Printing Workshop"Drypoint on acrylic sheet" refers to the printmaking technique of creating an image by scratching lines into a sheet of acrylic using a sharp tool, essentially "drypointing" on a plastic surface instead of the traditional copper plate, allowing you to then ink and press the plate onto paper to produce a printIn this workshop you will be learning how to make a drypoint plate using an acrylic sheet and how to print it. All the materials will be provided. The tools will be provided only for use. No prior experience required, we will teach you from scratch. You take home your carved plate with 2 prints. 🖼️🖼️ If you have a composition in mind that you want to work on, please get a sketch or a print out of it.  *Please keep in mind to choose a simple composition. Avoid compositions that require a lot of intricate carving.*Please reach the venue by 11am. Avoid wearing light coloured clothes.Join us at Studio Sakura 🌸 to unleash your creativity and experience the magic of printmaking.

name: The Lit Lounge: Readers Table
description: Calling all book lovers!The Lit Lounge is where readers meet, connect, and share their passion for powerful storytelling.Whether you’re a fan of classic novels or contemporary fiction, this is the perfect space to chat, exchange recommendations, and bond over books with new people.

organizer.name: HighTable
organizer.description: Meet a small group of strangers offline, with no agendas—just good conversations and genuine connections. Whether it’s a random thought or a deep dive, you never know where it might lead. Sometimes, the best connections happen when you least expect them.

name: The Girl Talk Chronicles: Let's Spill
description: *Only for Women* 🌸This night is all about unfiltered conversations, authentic connections, and celebrating the incredible women we are.No judgments, no filters—just real talk and genuine vibes.Whether you're here to share, listen, or just enjoy the energy, this night is for women to be unapologetically themselves.Hosted by Rajul: An absolute people’s person at heart! She thrive’s on connecting with others, exchanging stories, and learning from every conversation. Meeting new people and sharing experiences is her favorite thing to do.

description: New city, new vibes!The best way to feel at home in Bangalore?Meet others who are in the same boat!Grab a bite, share your experiences, and start your day with some fresh faces and great conversation.New city, new connections—let’s make breakfast the first step!💬

name: Naga Culinary Trails
description: THE Park Bangalore is thrilled to announce 'Naga Culinary Trails,' an exciting food pop-up happening from 31st January - 2nd February, 2025, exclusively at Monsoon. This five-day extravaganza is dedicated to exploring the world of Naga culinary culture, curated and led by food evangelist Yogita Uchil and an Anglo-Indian from Nagaland, Chef Alistair Lethorn, the Founder of Aal’s Kitchen in Vagator, Goa. This pop-up will be available to guests during lunch and dinner from 12:30 to 3:00 PM and 07 to 11 PM, respectively. At this pop-up, we have an exclusive Foodies Community Table, offering a fresh approach to dining, networking, and socializing. If you are looking to make new friends and bond over food, be prepared for an exciting and unique way to meet new people, form meaningful connections, and enjoy an all-new regional cuisine. Here's what you can look forward to:

location.address: The Park Hotel, 14 7, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Yellappa Garden, Yellappa Chetty Layout, Sivanchetti Gardens, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

organizer.name: THE Park Bangalore
organizer.description: **Here’s a condensed version of the text:**  THE Park, Bangalore is a luxury boutique hotel with 109 rooms. It offers various dining options like Monsoon (seasonal Indian cuisine), Aqua (poolside dining and tequila bar), Tap Room (craft beer), and I-Bar (cocktail lounge and nightclub).

name: Lobster Meets
description: For all the fans of popular sitcom FRIENDS you probably get why the name Lobster Meets.For all those looking for their lobster, new friends or just meet new people Lobster Meets is the place to be.Lobster Meets by Lobster Search is a socialising event for verified* singles.Our aim is to facilitate interaction amongst as many singles as possible in a warm, fun and lively environment.While we take no guarantees of cupid striking, we suggest you come with an open mind, as you may find a friend, a person with similar interests or potentially your forever person!We also pride in maintaining over 90% gender ratio at all our events!See you at the event!

location.address: Ward 72, Plot 1209, 100 Feet Rd, HAL 2nd Stage, Doopanahalli, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India
